instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil over medium heat.
Add the salt and sugar to the boiling water, stirring until dissolved.
Gradually whisk in the semolina to prevent lumps from forming.
Continue to cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and begins to pull away from the sides of the pot.
Remove from heat and stir in the olive oil and vanilla extract, if using.
Let the porridge cool slightly before serving.
notes: This traditional Tunisian-Djerban Jewish dish is often enjoyed as a comforting breakfast or dessert. It can be garnished with nuts or dried fruits for added flavor and texture.
